thread.title: Fans guide to this year's PGA Tour Shriners Open

title: Fans guide to this year's PGA Tour Shriners Open
text:
Fans guide to this year's PGA Tour Shriners Open Fans guide to this year's PGA Tour Shriners Open 
Ben Martin hits a drive ball from the 10th tee in the third round of the Shriners Hospitals for Children Open golf tournament at TPC Summerlin, 1700 Village Center Circle, in Las Vegas Saturday, Oct. 18, 2014. (Erik Verduzco/Las Vegas Review-Journal) Steve Carp 
Here are some facts about this year's PGA Tour Shriners Hospitals for Children Open: 
What: 33rd annual Shriners Hospital for Children Open 
When: Wednesday through Sunday 
Where: TPC Summerlin, 1700 Village Center Circle (7,255 yards, par 71) 
Schedule: Pro-Am (Wednesday); championship tournament (Thursday-Sunday) 
Purse: $6.4 million ($1,152,000 to winner) 
Defending champion: Ben Martin 
TV: The Golf Channel (Cable 339, DirecTV 218, Dish 401, CenturyLink 40), 2-5 p.m. Thursday-Sunday 
Tickets: $35 daily 
Parking: Free shuttle to course from Suncoast Hotel (Corner of Rampart Boulevard and Alta Drive); Valet parking at TPC Summerlin, $25 daily 
What's allowed: Bags no larger than 6 inches by 6 inches by 6 inches, mobile devices (must be on silent at all times), umbrellas, collapsible chairs (without chair bags) 
What's prohibited: Cameras (video or still), banners, signs, outside food and beverages, weapons and firearms, laser pointers, stepladders and step stools 
Tournament website: ShrinersHospitalsOpen.com Comment section guidelines The below comment section contains thoughts and opinions from users that in no way represent the views of the Las Vegas Review-Journal or GateHouse Media. This public platform is intended to provide a forum for users of reviewjournal.com to share ideas, express thoughtful opinions and carry the conversation beyond the article. Users must follow the guidelines under our Commenting Policy and are encouraged to use the moderation tools to help maintain civility and keep discussions on topic.
